title: The Future of the World Trade System after Doha: Enhancing Interaction between the Business and Trade Policy Communities
abstractText:
The Warwick Commission, an initiative to engage the public and private sector policy world on key issues of contemporary policy, is enquiring into “The Future of the Multilateral Trading System after Doha.” The Commission has taken evidence from witnesses, including politicians, practitioners, academics, key representative business organisations and other organisations with an interest in the world trading system. Through its website, the Commission encourages contributors to submit evidence and to engage in a two-way dialogue with Commissioners about their deliberations. Coming at a crucial time for the global trade regime and the World Trade Organization, the Commission will publish its report at the WTO in December 2007.

In maximising the impact of its report, the Commission will develop a debate between the business and trade policy communities about its recommendations, a central element of which will be a joint conference with the Confederation of British Industry (CBI) in London in January 2008. The Commission will also communicate its findings to UK and overseas business communities, which have a major interest in the health of the global trade regime, through a series of workshops and by developing a communications package, including broadcast standard videos and a content-rich website.
